intro: Tetrapterys crebriflora, commonly known as the common tetrapterys, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven segments. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. Tetrapterys crebriflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
